name: Still Life 4.0
description: Fizz Pop (b.1974), Still Life 4.0, 2009, 4200 x 3360 pixels  [Source: Hans Bollongier’s, Still Life with Flowers, 1639, oil on panel, 68cm x 54.5 cm]  --    The Golden Age of painting documents the first speculative bubble, a historic period with significant parallels to the current crypto movement.  The tulips in Still Life 4.0 are digital interpretations of the Semper Augustus tulip, the most valuable tulip during Tulip Mania; it’s stunning red & white petals are the result of a tulip mosaic virus.  In 2009 this piece was offered as a limited edition of 7 cibachrome prints, face-mounted to plexiglas, aluminum backed & braced.  Before the cibachrome print was discontinued only one from the edition was produced & sold.
